body:
Antis are always in our tags like What are you gonna do when Jonsa doesn’t happen? They write a bunch of Jonerys canon shit and then ask What do you Jonsas think about this?

Well.. we don’t care! We keep shipping! No matter how hard you try to prove us wrong, no matter If Jonerys is canon, or If Jon or Sansa or Dany die. Jonsa will still be shipped and written by the fans. Seriously stop, you can’t change our minds 😂😂😂

summary: You see, I have 2 ideas for a multi-chapter Petyr x Sansa fanfiction once I finish The Bet. I don't know which one I should...
body:
You see, I have 2 ideas for a multi-chapter Petyr x Sansa fanfiction once I finish The Bet. I don’t know which one I should write first:

1. Sansa dealing with PTSD after everything she went through with Ramsay and Petyr helping her deal with that. It’s post-battle of the bastards and season 7 rewriting (so it’s set in the universe of ASOIF).

2. Sansa hires Petyr to be her date on Margaery and Tommen’s wedding. The problem is that Sansa was dumped by Harry and he is Tommen’s best man, so she doesn’t want to go there as a miserable single woman. That’s where Petyr comes into scene. (Yess, this is inspired by a chick-flick)

summary: Game of Thrones (TV): Sansa’s important prayers, and a white lie she once told Tyrion In 4x01, Sansa tells her husband Tyrion of...
caption:
Game of Thrones (TV): Sansa’s important prayers, and a white lie she once told Tyrion

In 4x01, Sansa tells her husband Tyrion of House Lannister, “Would you pardon me, my lord? I’d like to visit the godswood.” And then he says, “Of course, of course. Prayer can be helpful, I hear.” And then she says, “I don’t pray anymore. It’s the only place I can go where people don’t talk to me.”

But then 15 minutes later, we see not one but two shots of Sansa at prayer in the show’s version of the King’s Landing godswood. We can even seen her lips moving in the first shot, just as Ned Stark’s lips moved in spoken prayer just before he was beheaded.

So Sansa lied to Tyrion. She does pray. She prayed in season three as well, and when Margaery Tyrell asked her about it, Sansa was unusually firm in her refusal to disclose the subject of her prayers. Sansa was, at that stage, highly compliant and susceptible to manipulation, but Marge’s best efforts failed. Which tells me that Sansa’s prayers are very important at least to Sansa.

And then, in 6x10 we have a third, similar scene scene. After the Starks reclaim Winterfell, Littlefinger seeks out Sansa in the snowy godswood. 

It’s a beautiful shot and Sansa sits in the exact same spot as Ned sat in episode one. Baelish approaches her and his first words assume her piety: “Forgive me, my lady, if you’re at prayer.” And she says, as world-weary and jaded as can be, “I’m done with all that.”

But I sincerely doubt that’s true. I think Sansa hides her prayer from people now–this is a pattern of three. Perhaps it’s because in the years she was alone in King’s Landing, she was mocked roundly by the Lannisters for prayer. 

The Lannisters are quite godless–they believe in themselves–and Cersei mocked her for praying during the Battle of the Blackwater, whereas Tyrion believed that Sansa was insulting him when she said that she would pray for his safe return, just as she prayed for the King’s. (OK, that might have been right.)

I’m not sure what all this adds up to, but I suspect:

(a) Sansa’s faith and practice of prayer/meditation/quiet contemplation will appear in season 8.

(b) Her “faith” has a very personal aspect to it which we do not yet understand. My personal hunch is that it’s one of the channels through which her warg/skinchanger powers manifest. Bran goes fully unconscious (until he becomes the Three-Eyed Raven) but I suspect Sansa can do it while “awake” but in a kind of fugue state. See also moments in the books like when she seems to fade out after Sandor leaves her at the Battle of the Blackwater and when she apparently passes out in the Eyrie godswood.

tl;dr: Sansa’s practice of secret prayer has a magical aspect that will be crucial in season eight.

Modern AU where Sansa is trying to get on with her life after Joff. They’ve been broken up for long enough that her friends are starting to worry. summary: Sansa Stark and the Misty Morn
title: Sansa Stark and the Misty Morn
body:
So, Sansa’s first AFFC chapter includes a list of the sad songs Marillion sings from his sky cell.  There is ten songs mentioned, of which three are only given descriptions (which I almost believe might be important), and six of which are only given titles, so I’m going to talk about the tenth.  That song is “On a Misty Morn”, about a mother looking for a son she can’t find after a battle.  It’s significant as the only one mentioned that is also given lyrics, one of only a handful of songs in the series with official lyrics.

Here are the lyrics:

Oh, have you seen my boy, good ser?
His hair is chestnut brown
He’d promised he’d come back to me
Our home’s in Wendish Town.

Now I was just going disregard this as just another song used for world immersion, but Wendish Town is an actual town in the Riverlands.  It’s mentioned in AGOT as one of the place ravaged by the Mountain and his men.  But where is it in the Riverlands?  It has two semi-canonical locations, either just south of the Blue Fork (if you’re going off the Game of Thrones official map) or the Green Fork (if you go by the ASOIAF Roleplay Campaign Guide). I’m going by the GOT map location, because it fits better with the bit of information given to us about it.  It being on the Blue Fork puts it closer to the Mummer’s Fort and Sherrer (the other locations attacked) as well as closer to Castle Darry, their liege lords.  So I’m putting it on the Blue Fork as well.  Now to the point, I know it seems so far away.

I believe Sansa is going to Wendish Town in TWOW.  We all know Sansa doesn’t have much time left in the Vale, and that she is likely the girl in grey heading for Jon.  The show more or less spelled this out, whether I choose to like the show or not.  I’m not going to talk about the color of Sansa’s cloak, because I’m not about beating her dying horse.  I’m going to talk about how she’s making it North.  The answer is a ship for at least part of the way.  The only other way would be to try and ride that, and I don’t see Sansa trying to go through the Twins.  So she needs a port town.  Spoiler: it’s Wendish Town.

Sansa is at the Gates of the Moon as a her TWOW spoiler chapter, and from there the closest ports are to her north, south, and east.  Why doesn’t she go to any of those?  North and south are blocked by mountains, and the Hill Tribes are more ferocious than ever because of Tyrion.  She could go to Gulltown to the east, but that would be the first place someone would assume she’d go.  That sends her west past the Bloody Gate and down the High Road towards the Trident.  Now she’s in trouble, she’s in the Riverlands and they’ve been on fire since Wendish Town was first mentioned, so she has to pick a direction quick.  And the only choice is deeper into outlaw territory.  Going east towards the Bay of Crabs isn’t a option, the Saltpans are basically on fire and it’s Lannister land.  The Red Fork leads her to the Lannister held Riverrun, the Green Fork leads her to the Frey held Twins, the means the middle path is her only option.  And what is the middle path but the Blue Fork.  

Which is where Wendish Town likely lies, and being just off the Blue Fork, and just south of Seagard, means more likely than not Wendish Town is a port town.  From there, Sansa can get passage either to Seagard that the Shadow Tower, or less likely straight to the Shadow Tower.  Now we know, she isn’t going to make it there by boat.  The winter winds have caused even the most experience crews to crash recently, and the stony sept is already dangerous because of the Ironmen in the water.  So the boat crashes, more probably off the Stony Shore because of those Ironborn I just mentioned last sentence.  Which puts her in the Wolfswood, and back up on her dying horse.

Let’s backtrack a bit though, because there’s something else in the same area as Wendish Town.  Well someone, well someones. I’ve been ignoring them since the start of this thing.  You know what Sansa has to pass through to get to the coast?  Fairmarket, the last known general area of the former Lady Catelyn, now known as the Lady Stoneheart.  I won’t focus more on this because I’ve already seen metas written about Sansa coming across Lady Stoneheart and the effects it could have on Sansa or Sansa could have on her.  It’s a meta for another day, probably from someone better than me who wouldn’t write a meta about a town whose claim to fame is a sad song someone sings just before they die.  Jaime and Brienne are also there too if they’re still alive, which is fortune because they were in fact looking for her.  Saves them a bit of trouble.

Now is there any of hints in the song itself?  Somewhat.  While it is a mother looking for her son in the song, the meaning is hits about as well.  Like the mother, Sansa is searching for a family member who is likely dead.  They’re both full of grief.  There is the mention of chestnut hair, a color similar to the burnt brown Sansa describes her hair being once it’s dyed.

Then there is use of the word “misty” in title.  The Misty in the song’s title could be a reference to the bay mist from Ironmen’s Bay, but it’s also a reference to the mother in the song; her eyes misty with tears for her son.  It could also be a reference to someone confused or lost, maybe in reference to Sansa. Less flushed out then Wendish Town, I know.  I wanted to close on a high point while also justifying calling this “Sansa Stark and the Misty Morn” because it’s a better title than my other idea which was “A Funny Thing Happened on Sansa’s Way to Wendish Town”.

Last note, Wendish Town probably doesn’t have anything to do with the historical Wends.  I’m done now though, you can close this page or continuing scrolling past half reading.

Now I was just going disregard this as just another song used for world immersion, but Wendish Town is an actual town in the Riverlands.  It’s mentioned in AGOT as one of the place ravaged by the Mountain and his men.  But where is it in the Riverlands?  It has two semi-canonical locations, either just south of the Blue Fork (if you’re going off the Game of Thrones official map) or the Green Fork (if you go by the ASOIAF Roleplay Campaign Guide). I’m going by the GOT map location, because it fits better with the bit of information given to us about it.  It being on the Blue Fork puts it closer to the Mummer’s Fort and Sherrer (the other locations attacked) as well as closer to Castle Darry, their liege lords.  So I’m putting it on the Blue Fork as well.  Now to the point, I know it seems so far away.

I believe Sansa is going to Wendish Town in TWOW.  We all know Sansa doesn’t have much time left in the Vale, and that she is likely the girl in grey heading for Jon.  The show more or less spelled this out, whether I choose to like the show or not.  I’m not going to talk about the color of Sansa’s cloak, because I’m not about beating her dying horse.  I’m going to talk about how she’s making it North.  The answer is a ship for at least part of the way.  The only other way would be to try and ride that, and I don’t see Sansa trying to go through the Twins.  So she needs a port town.  Spoiler: it’s Wendish Town.

Sansa is at the Gates of the Moon as a her TWOW spoiler chapter, and from there the closest ports are to her north, south, and east.  Why doesn’t she go to any of those?  North and south are blocked by mountains, and the Hill Tribes are more ferocious than ever because of Tyrion.  She could go to Gulltown to the east, but that would be the first place someone would assume she’d go.  That sends her west past the Bloody Gate and down the High Road towards the Trident.  Now she’s in trouble, she’s in the Riverlands and they’ve been on fire since Wendish Town was first mentioned, so she has to pick a direction quick.  And the only choice is deeper into outlaw territory.  Going east towards the Bay of Crabs isn’t a option, the Saltpans are basically on fire and it’s Lannister land.  The Red Fork leads her to the Lannister held Riverrun, the Green Fork leads her to the Frey held Twins, the means the middle path is her only option.  And what is the middle path but the Blue Fork.  

Which is where Wendish Town likely lies, and being just off the Blue Fork, and just south of Seagard, means more likely than not Wendish Town is a port town.  From there, Sansa can get passage either to Seagard that the Shadow Tower, or less likely straight to the Shadow Tower.  Now we know, she isn’t going to make it there by boat.  The winter winds have caused even the most experience crews to crash recently, and the stony sept is already dangerous because of the Ironmen in the water.  So the boat crashes, more probably off the Stony Shore because of those Ironborn I just mentioned last sentence.  Which puts her in the Wolfswood, and back up on her dying horse.

Let’s backtrack a bit though, because there’s something else in the same area as Wendish Town.  Well someone, well someones. I’ve been ignoring them since the start of this thing.  You know what Sansa has to pass through to get to the coast?  Fairmarket, the last known general area of the former Lady Catelyn, now known as the Lady Stoneheart.  I won’t focus more on this because I’ve already seen metas written about Sansa coming across Lady Stoneheart and the effects it could have on Sansa or Sansa could have on her.  It’s a meta for another day, probably from someone better than me who wouldn’t write a meta about a town whose claim to fame is a sad song someone sings just before they die.  Jaime and Brienne are also there too if they’re still alive, which is fortune because they were in fact looking for her.  Saves them a bit of trouble.

Now is there any of hints in the song itself?  Somewhat.  While it is a mother looking for her son in the song, the meaning is hits about as well.  Like the mother, Sansa is searching for a family member who is likely dead.  They’re both full of grief.  There is the mention of chestnut hair, a color similar to the burnt brown Sansa describes her hair being once it’s dyed.

Then there is use of the word “misty” in title.  The Misty in the song’s title could be a reference to the bay mist from Ironmen’s Bay, but it’s also a reference to the mother in the song; her eyes misty with tears for her son.  It could also be a reference to someone confused or lost, maybe in reference to Sansa. Less flushed out then Wendish Town, I know.  I wanted to close on a high point while also justifying calling this “Sansa Stark and the Misty Morn” because it’s a better title than my other idea which was “A Funny Thing Happened on Sansa’s Way to Wendish Town”.

Last note, Wendish Town probably doesn’t have anything to do with the historical Wends.  I’m done now though, you can close this page or continuing scrolling past half reading.

summary: “What are you doing here?” Sandor growled at the two women in front of him.   “You weren’t picking up your phone.” Sansa said...
caption:
“What are you doing here?” Sandor growled at the two women in front of him. 

“You weren’t picking up your phone.” Sansa said looking put out. 

“Yeah! How were we supposed to know you went to the movies? You could have decided to start the apocalypse or something.” Arya said earning herself a glare from her sister. Sandor may still have trouble with phones, but Arya had yet to figure out that there were more people around than there used to be and more of a need for her to keep her mouth shut. 

modern Gods/Goddess Au- Sandor (Simargl), Sansa (the morning star/Zorya Utrennyaya), and Arya (the evening star/Zorya Vechernyaya) share a house in the modern world and high-jinks ensue

summary: Bran: Did you ever see that movie, the one where there's this cowboy. And he's king of the castle. And then this astronaut shows...
body:
Bran: Did you ever see that movie, the one where there’s this cowboy. And he’s king of the castle. And then this astronaut shows up, and tries to take over. And so the cowboy attempts to murder him. But instead, the astronaut is taken hostage by an evil psychopath. And the cowboy has to rescue him. And then they end up becoming really good friends.

Sansa: …Toy Story?

Bran: That’s it. I love that movie.

summary: I just got finished reading @silkygoldmilkweed‘s SanSan post and I was so amazed I got inspired to write why I love SanSan...
body:
I just got finished reading @silkygoldmilkweed‘s SanSan post and I was so amazed I got inspired to write why I love SanSan despite it *looking* “problematic”.

I hate problematic ships revolving around two characters being so drastically different in ages (I’ve never shipped one, either), even more so when the fandoms sexualize said relationships. But the thing that draws me to SanSan is that it’s NEVER EVER ONCE sexual from Sandor > Sansa. It’s always so chaste and honest. He’s there to genuinely protect her, to keep her company sometimes even, and to let her feel safe. He doesn’t do it for honor or because he’s going to get “something” from it, he does it for Sansa. It’s an honorable and innocent devotion he has for her. It’s not manipulative or fake. He really treats her with respect because he wants the best for her. 

I’ve only seen the show, but what I’ve read from the books about SanSan makes me believe this even more. 

Sandor’s love for Sansa now, he may not even realize is romantic. I feel like it’s an unspoken destiny they both have to love one another but neither are aware that this love they have is because there is a romantic connection waiting to bloom between them when the proper time comes. 

That’s why I hate when people make SanSan out to be this “gross” ship, when it’s by far the healthiest ship in GOT (imo) because Sandor actively checks himself about Sansa’s age, he never sexualizes her, Sandor does things for Sansa not “for himself” and because he just cares for her genuinely.

summary: I need to share you very important details from season 8 teaser ...Please share everyone ....!!!!!!
title: I need to share you very important details from season 8 teaser ...Please share everyone ....!!!!!!
body:
This is what I was always talking about . Sansa who betryed to Ned stark and informed Cersei about his planns in season 1.  She told to Cersei that Ned  planned to escape from Kings Landing 

There is a very interesting detail. Nobody knows about that in North. neither Arya,Jon or …Probably Bran knows about that. Why nobody spoke about that during 7 season?
Do you remember what happened after Sansa’s action? Cersei’s people mudrered Northern people who acompaned to Ned Stark from Winterfell. There were 300  man…
There is very special detail. who Knows about Sansas betrayal action? there is only 3 character stil alive: Cersei,Tyrion and Varys.
Tyrion and Varys are #TeamDany. Cersei is their enemy. 
she wants to break Stark house. what is the best maner for that?Tell the Starks that Sansa betrayed their father and he became a prissioner because of Sansa. 
look at this scene where Cersei meet to Jon 

is Cersei teling about Sansa to Jon?
Look at this season 8 teaser. there is very special detail’s from Ned Stark’s execution. There is two scene from Ned Starks’s death.
look …just look 

Do you remember Arya’s words to Sansa in season 7? 

ARYA: We both wanted to be other people when we were younger. You wanted to be a Queen, to sit next to a handsome Prince on the Iron Throne. I wanted to be a knight: to pick up a sword, like Father, and go off to battle. Neither of us got to be the other person, did we? The world doesn’t just let girls decide what they’re going to be. But I can, now. With the Faces, I can choose… I can become someone else. Speak in their voice, live in their skin. I could even become you.

(She mentioned Ned there too. with Sansa)

scene from season 7 where Arya read Sansa’s letter. This is letter from Cersei after Sansa informed about Ned. Why the used this detail ? 

Arya to Sansa: I would have let them to kill me before I betrayed my family …I remember you standing on that platform with Joffry and Cersei when thet dragged father to the block. I remember pretty dress you were wearing ….(Arya mentioned her father Ned Stark again.and especially his death  )

and another scene from season 8 teaser 

Arya Stark looked her father’s death

look at return of the Bran Stark in Winterfell. His meeting with Sansa. No emotion with his face. 

different from Sansa Bran hugged to Arya and Smiled 

But what happened when Bran gave a knife to Arya? He looked at Sansa exactly in this scene . 

And finaly. HBO realised season 8 posters and there is only 3 Stark :Arya,Jon and Bran. The puck survive ,but Lone wolf die …

There is no Sansa poster from House Stark. she is a lone walf and it’s fact. 

Cersei tells Jon about Sansa’s  betrayal.

And you think that someone will hear her explenation in north? 
‘‘I was a child?’‘ There were killed 300 northern men for Sansa. Ned Stark became a prisioner for her stupidity. Can you imagined Jon and Arya reaction about that?
